Class GameBoard

java.lang.Object
GameBoard
public class GameBoard extends Object
This class represents a game board, or more accurately a bitBoard. It is used by several game components to keep track of board positions. The players use their own GameBoard objects to keep track of their moves, and the main game board uses a GameBoard object to keep track of the entire board.

    • calculateScore

      public int calculateScore(long boardMask)
      Method to calculate the score of a board state. Instead of carefully maintaining the score of each player, we just discard previous scores and recalculate the whole board. This seems to be a good approach in the off chance someone rolls six of a kind and it impacts another player's score. Additionally, with the multipliers, the score of many markers can be impacted by a single one.
      Parameters:
      boardMask - The bitmask of the board.
      Returns:
      The score of the board position.
